intro: Sisymbrium ferganense, commonly known as the Fergana mustard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and it produces slender, elongated pods that contain seeds. Sisymbrium ferganense is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid environments.
